replies.msg:
分開幾個aspect黎reply

A) "針對內容解釋/反駁返"
本來就係你提出"本身女人要男人揪住都好正常"先 你都未解釋就chur我要解釋
然後你申述左之後又要人自己google source 連論據都要聽個個幫你搵埋

B) gender difference
男同女當然有分別 但係你部分量化比較既結論(女人先天對表情情感敏感啲) 我唔同意

Gender differences in emotional development: A review of theories and research (Leslie R Brody, 1985)
Theories, data, methodological and conceptual problems concerning the study of gender differences in the development of defenses, emotional expression, recognition, and experiences are reviewed Data indicate gender differences in several areas of emotional functioning, including nonverbal sensitivity, expressiveness, self‐reports of anger, fear, and sadness, the quality of defenses, and cognitive correlates of recognition abilities Studies suggest that with development, boys increasingly inhibit the expression and attribution of most emotions, whereas girls increasingly inhibit the expression and recognition of socially unacceptable emotions, e g, anger These differences may be a function of different socialization processes for males and females , which may be adaptations to innate gender differences in temperament, or adaptations to existing sociocultural pressures

Sex Differences in Emotion (Stephen R. Wester, David L. Vogel, Page K. Pressly Martin Heesacker, 2002)
This article examines the findings of several reviews of the empirical literature on biological sex and emotion, focusing on the degree to which perceived sex differences in emotionality are, and in most cases are not, supported while at the same time addressing the implications this body of research has for counseling psychologists. This article also explores potential explanations, such as gender role socialization or situational influences, for the profession’s continued acceptance of large innate sex-based affective differences. Finally, the third section discusses several concerns this continued acceptance raises for the practice of counseling, whereas the last section offers a research agenda building on the review presented herein.

窮撚無得睇全文 只係睇到abstract
所以唯有睇埋人人可編輯公信力不高既wiki
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gender_and_emotional_expression
The topic of gender and emotion is often reduced to attempts to identify the differences between women, men, and the various ways in which they express their emotions. Stereotypes are powerful, and men and women from various cultures have been shown to accept the Western stereotype that women are more emotional than men.[1] Specifically, women are believed to experience and express discrete emotions such as happiness, fear, disgust, and sadness more than men.
Many researchers have concluded that the observed emotional differences between men and women primarily stem from socialized gender roles, rather than biology. Thus, the range of emotional expression that certain populations experience is based, in large part, on their culture's expectations for femininity and masculinity.[2]

C) 自然主義謬誤
呢個概念我今朝係同性戀論據PO到見到
自然天性與道德規範無關
正如David Hume所講
單從「實然」命題不能推導出「應然」命題

即使呢一刻好多情侶都係男方比較理性 比較多去思考
都唔能夠推論出 "男方應當理性" "男方唔理性就係on9唔成熟" "單單要求男方理性女方唔駛係合理"
十七十八世紀奴隸制度合法 有好多黑人被捉去做奴隸(實然) 咁並唔代表黑人天生應該做奴隸(應然)

Thus, the range of emotional expression that certain populations experience is based, in large part, on their culture's expectations for femininity and masculinity.[2]

C) 自然主義謬誤
呢個概念我今朝係同性戀論據PO到見到
自然天性與道德規範無關
正如David Hume所講
單從「實然」命題不能推導出「應然」命題

即使呢一刻好多情侶都係男方比較理性 比較多去思考
都唔能夠推論出 "男方應當理性" "男方唔理性就係on9唔成熟" "單單要求男方理性女方唔駛係合理"
十七十八世紀奴隸制度合法 有好多黑人被捉去做奴隸(實然) 咁並唔代表黑人天生應該做奴隸(應然)

quote.msg:
google啦
呢啲research都唔知做咗幾多年喇
俾埋keyword你：gender differences in human development

分開幾個aspect黎reply

A) "針對內容解釋/反駁返"
本來就係你提出"本身女人要男人揪住都好正常"先 你都未解釋就chur我要解釋
然後你申述左之後又要人自己google source 連論據都要聽個個幫你搵埋

B) gender difference
男同女當然有分別 但係你部分量化比較既結論(女人先天對表情情感敏感啲) 我唔同意

Gender differences in emotional development: A review of theories and research (Leslie R Brody, 1985)
Theories, data, methodological and conceptual problems concerning the study of gender differences in the development of defenses, emotional expression, recognition, and experiences are reviewed Data indicate gender differences in several areas of emotional functioning, including nonverbal sensitivity, expressiveness, self‐reports of anger, fear, and sadness, the quality of defenses, and cognitive correlates of recognition abilities Studies suggest that with development, boys increasingly inhibit the expression and attribution of most emotions, whereas girls increasingly inhibit the expression and recognition of socially unacceptable emotions, e g, anger These differences may be a function of different socialization processes for males and females , which may be adaptations to innate gender differences in temperament, or adaptations to existing sociocultural pressures

Sex Differences in Emotion (Stephen R. Wester, David L. Vogel, Page K. Pressly Martin Heesacker, 2002)
This article examines the findings of several reviews of the empirical literature on biological sex and emotion, focusing on the degree to which perceived sex differences in emotionality are, and in most cases are not, supported while at the same time addressing the implications this body of research has for counseling psychologists. This article also explores potential explanations, such as gender role socialization or situational influences, for the profession’s continued acceptance of large innate sex-based affective differences. Finally, the third section discusses several concerns this continued acceptance raises for the practice of counseling, whereas the last section offers a research agenda building on the review presented herein.

窮撚無得睇全文 只係睇到abstract
所以唯有睇埋人人可編輯公信力不高既wiki
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gender_and_emotional_expression
The topic of gender and emotion is often reduced to attempts to identify the differences between women, men, and the various ways in which they express their emotions. Stereotypes are powerful, and men and women from various cultures have been shown to accept the Western stereotype that women are more emotional than men.[1] Specifically, women are believed to experience and express discrete emotions such as happiness, fear, disgust, and sadness more than men.
Many researchers have concluded that the observed emotional differences between men and women primarily stem from socialized gender roles, rather than biology. Thus, the range of emotional expression that certain populations experience is based, in large part, on their culture's expectations for femininity and masculinity.[2]

正如David Hume所講
單從「實然」命題不能推導出「應然」命題

即使呢一刻好多情侶都係男方比較理性 比較多去思考
都唔能夠推論出 "男方應當理性" "男方唔理性就係on9唔成熟" "單單要求男方理性女方唔駛係合理"
十七十八世紀奴隸制度合法 有好多黑人被捉去做奴隸(實然) 咁並唔代表黑人天生應該做奴隸(應然)
